inclusion.criterion: minimum of 2 years of previous history of perennial allergic rhinitis to at least one perennial allergen at the time the study is being conducted.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Signed informed consent form. For patients under the age of majority the parent or legal guardian should sign the consent form and the child will be required to sign a patient "assent" form.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Subjects with perennial allergic rhinitis documented in writing positive allergic skin (a wheal >3mm) test or positive RAST test, performed at screening or within the past 12 months.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: A score of at least 6 on the TNSS with a minimum score of at least 2 for "nasal congestion" and a minimum score of at least 2 for one of the remaining 3 symptoms.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Subjects capable of recording nasal allergy diary every day.
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: who are pregnant, lactating or plan to get pregnant during the study.
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: History of asthma over the previous two years that required chronic therapy (with the exception of occasional acute or mild exercise induced asthma).
exclusion.label: triggers

notes: The patient has a history of asthma for 3 years, suffering from frequent cough, wheezing, and shortness of breath and chest tightness. He is currently using inhaled corticosteroid (ICS) and fluticasone 500 mcg/salmeterol 50 mcg, one puff twice daily.
